FREELANCER.Definition: a person who works for different companies without one regular boss

FREELANCE.Definition: working on your own, not for one regular boss

COINED.Definition: created or invented (for a new word or phrase)

IDEOLOGICALLY.Definition: in a way that showed what they believed

SPEARS.Definition: long sticks with a sharp point used as weapons

BIDDER.Definition: a person who offered money for it

NATIONHOOD.Definition: the state of being a nation or country

CONVINCING.Definition: making someone agree with you about it

ABSTRACT.Definition: not clear or real, only an idea

CHAOTIC.Definition: in a state of confusion and disorder

BETRAYED.Definition: acted against the people that trusted him

DECISIVELY.Definition: in a clear and strong way

ELIMINATING.Definition: removing or getting rid of completely

CONSORTIUM.Definition: a group of people working together

BETTER OFF.Definition: in a better or safer situation

PROSPECT.Definition: the chance of it happening in the future

LIABILITY.Definition: something that caused trouble or harm

MATCH.Definition: to be equal in strength or ability

SWATHE.Definition: a large area or strip of land

LOGISTICAL.Definition: relating to planning how to move things and organise supplies

LOGISTICS.Definition: the planning of moving things and supplies

PROMINENCE.Definition: the state of being well-known or important

INTERSECTION.Definition: a place where roads meet or cross

ACCOUNTABILITY.Definition: the fact of being responsible for what they do

IMPUNITY.Definition: not being punished for what they do

COMBATANTS.Definition: soldiers or fighters in a war

LOOPHOLES.Definition: gaps in rules that let people avoid them

REPACKAGED.Definition: changed and sold again in a new way

ACKNOWLEDGE.Definition: admit or accept that they are true

VETERANS.Definition: people who have served in the military

PLAUSIBLE DENIABILITY.Definition: The ability to deny involvement because there was no clear proof

CALLING UP.Definition: asking people to join the military

RESERVIST.Definition: not full-time but can be called to serve

EXTRAJUDICIAL.Definition: done outside the legal system or courts

TORTURE.Definition: causing very strong pain or suffering

ALLEGEDLY.Definition: said to be true, but not proven

STATE ACTOR.Definition: a group that represents the government

SHIFT.Definition: change or move from one thing to the other

PARAMILITARIES.Definition: groups that act like soldiers but are not the regular army
